text: Duncan Wood (24 March 1925 in Bristol, England - 11 January 1997) was a British comedy producer, director and writer. His best-known achievements were to produce all of Tony Hancock's Half Hours for BBC TV during the late 1950s and early 1960s, and later, also with Hancock's former writers Ray Galton and Alan Simpson, the sitcom Steptoe and Son for most of its run. He also produced the first series of The Bed-Sit Girl. From 1972–73, he was the BBC's Head of Comedy, replacing Michael Mills. He left in 1973 to become Head of Light Entertainment at Yorkshire Television and was responsible for commissioning Rising Damp. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1925 births Category:1997 deaths Category:British television producers Category:People from Bristol
